intro: Agaloma retusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved agaloma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged oppositely. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent central tube. Agaloma retusa is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
